# Controlling Shape Drawing with Shaders

**Article**

Change a shape node’s appearance by supplying custom shader code.

## Overview

When you want to go beyond the effects provided by a shape node’s properties, you can take full control of its stroking or filling by using the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShapeNode/strokeShader] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShapeNode/fillShader] properties, respectively. To do that, you supply custom OpenGL ES shader code embedded within a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShader] object. Custom shaders allow you to create custom effects, such as dashed lines and gradient strokes, and custom fills, such as checkerboards and random patterns.

### Customize a Shape Node’s Stroke

Shape nodes have two additional stroke-related properties that extend the properties defined by [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShader]:



By dividing the distance along the path by the total length of the path, you get the normalized position (between `0` and `1`) of each point along a shape node’s path and use it to construct the color of each pixel along the shape node’s stroke. ### Customize a Shape Node’s Fill

You create a custom fill for a shape node by writing shader code and embedding it within an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShader] object. Assigning the shader to the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShapeNode/fillShader] property overrides the appearance that would otherwise be defined by [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShapeNode/fillColor] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKShapeNode/fillTexture].

The following shader code demonstrates filling a shape node with a simple checkerboard texture. Inside the shader, the variables `h` and `v` would, on their own, form horizontal and vertical stripes. The exclusive or operator, `^`, creates the checkerboard pattern from those stripes.

## Customizing Stroking or Fill Drawing

- **strokeShader**: A custom shader used to determine the color of the stroked portion of the shape node.
- **fillShader**: A custom shader used to determine the color of the filled portion of the shape node.
- **attributeValues**: The values of each attribute associated with the node’s attached shader.
- **setValue(_:forAttribute:)**: Sets an attribute value for an attached shader.
- **value(forAttributeNamed:)**: The value of a shader attribute.
